wtf.nucker.spigotutilities.utils

Class ClockUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • wtf.nucker.spigotutilities.utils.ClockUtils

  • public class ClockUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A useful class for using time in your plugins
    Author:
    Nucker
    See Also:
    This TimeUnit class for more usful time converstion

      • ticksToSeconds

        public static long ticksToSeconds(long ticks)
        A method to convert ticks to seconds
        Parameters:
        ticks - the amount of ticks you want to convert
        Returns:
        the ticks provided as seconds

      • secondsToTicks

        public static long secondsToTicks(long seconds)
        A method to convert seconds to ticks
        Parameters:
        seconds - the amount of seconds you want to convert
        Returns:
        the seconds provided as ticks

      • countDown

        public static void countDown(int amount,
                             org.bukkit.util.Consumer<ClockUtils.CountingRunnable> runningCode,
                             org.bukkit.util.Consumer<ClockUtils.CountingRunnable> endCode)
        A method to run countdowns easily in your plugins
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of seconds you want to countdown from
        runningCode - The code ran every time one second of the countdown passes (includes the last tick). The consumer extends the ClockUtils.CountingRunnable class.
        endCode - The code ran at the end when the countdown reaches its final tick The consumer extends the ClockUtils.CountingRunnable class.

      • countUp

        public static void countUp(int amount,
                           org.bukkit.util.Consumer<ClockUtils.CountingRunnable> runningCode,
                           org.bukkit.util.Consumer<ClockUtils.CountingRunnable> endCode)
        A method to run count ups easily in your plugins
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of seconds you want to countdown from
        runningCode - The code ran every time one second of the countdown passes (includes the last tick). The consumer extends the ClockUtils.CountingRunnable class.
        endCode - The code ran at the end when the countdown reaches its final tick The consumer extends the ClockUtils.CountingRunnable class.

      • runCodeLater

        public static void runCodeLater(int delay,
                                org.bukkit.util.Consumer<org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitRunnable> runCode)
        Runs your code after a delay
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay between you calling the method and running the code.
        runCode - The code ran when the delay ends. The consumer extends the ClockUtils.CountingRunnable class.

      • runInterval

        public static org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitRunnable runInterval(int delay,
                                                              org.bukkit.util.Consumer<ClockUtils.CountingRunnable> runCode)
        Runs code after delay on repeat until.
        Parameters:
        delay - The delay between each code run
        runCode - The code ran when the delay is completed
        Returns:
        The runnable instance so you can cancel it if you want
